intro: Fuscospora solandri, commonly known as the black spored fern, is a species of fern native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its dark, almost black spores. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forests and rock crevices. Its fronds are usually leathery and have a distinctive, rugged appearance. Fuscospora solandri plays a role in the ecological dynamics of its native habitat, contributing to soil stability and providing shelter for small organisms.
